verses.kjv: Hear, O Israel: Thou art to pass over Jordan this day, to go in to possess nations greater and mightier than thyself, cities great and fenced up to heaven,
verses.ct: Listen, Israel: Today you are about to cross the Jordan to take over nations that are larger and more powerful than you, with huge cities that have walls reaching to the heavens.

verses.kjv: A people great and tall, the children of the Anakims, whom thou knowest, and of whom thou hast heard say, Who can stand before the children of Anak!
verses.ct: The people there are large and tall — descendants of the Anakites. You know about them, and you've heard people say, 'Who can stand against the descendants of Anak!'

verses.kjv: Understand therefore this day, that the LORD thy God is he which goeth over before thee; as a consuming fire he shall destroy them, and he shall bring them down before thy face: so shalt thou drive them out, and destroy them quickly, as the LORD hath said unto thee.
verses.ct: So recognize today that the LORD your God is the one going ahead of you. Like a consuming fire, he will destroy them and bring them down in front of you. You will drive them out and wipe them out quickly, just as the LORD has told you.

verses.kjv: Speak not thou in thine heart, after that the LORD thy God hath cast them out from before thee, saying, For my righteousness the LORD hath brought me in to possess this land: but for the wickedness of these nations the LORD doth drive them out from before thee.
verses.ct: After the LORD your God has pushed them out ahead of you, don't tell yourself, 'The LORD brought me here to take this land because of my righteousness.' No — it's because of the wickedness of these nations that the LORD is driving them out ahead of you.

verses.kjv: Not for thy righteousness, or for the uprightness of thine heart, dost thou go to possess their land: but for the wickedness of these nations the LORD thy God doth drive them out from before thee, and that he may perform the word which the LORD sware unto thy fathers, Abraham, Isaac, and Jacob.
verses.ct: It is not because of your righteousness or the goodness of your heart that you are going in to take their land. Rather, it's because of the wickedness of these nations that the LORD your God is driving them out ahead of you, and to fulfill the promise the LORD made to your ancestors — Abraham, Isaac, and Jacob.

verses.kjv: Understand therefore, that the LORD thy God giveth thee not this good land to possess it for thy righteousness; for thou art a stiffnecked people.
verses.ct: So understand this: the LORD your God is not giving you this good land because of your righteousness, because you are a stubborn people.

verses.kjv: Remember, and forget not, how thou provokedst the LORD thy God to wrath in the wilderness: from the day that thou didst depart out of the land of Egypt, until ye came unto this place, ye have been rebellious against the LORD.
verses.ct: Remember — don't ever forget — how you provoked the LORD your God in the wilderness. From the day you left Egypt until you arrived at this place, you have been rebellious against the LORD.

verses.kjv: Also in Horeb ye provoked the LORD to wrath, so that the LORD was angry with you to have destroyed you.
verses.ct: Even at Horeb you provoked the LORD so much that he was angry enough to destroy you.

verses.kjv: When I was gone up into the mount to receive the tables of stone, even the tables of the covenant which the LORD made with you, then I abode in the mount forty days and forty nights, I neither did eat bread nor drink water:
verses.ct: When I went up the mountain to receive the stone tablets — the tablets of the covenant that the LORD made with you — I stayed on the mountain for 40 days and 40 nights. I ate no food and drank no water.

verses.kjv: And the LORD delivered unto me two tables of stone written with the finger of God; and on them was written according to all the words, which the LORD spake with you in the mount out of the midst of the fire in the day of the assembly.
verses.ct: The LORD gave me 2 stone tablets inscribed by the finger of God. Written on them were all the words the LORD spoke to you on the mountain from the middle of the fire on the day of the assembly.

verses.kjv: And it came to pass at the end of forty days and forty nights, that the LORD gave me the two tables of stone, even the tables of the covenant.
verses.ct: At the end of 40 days and 40 nights, the LORD gave me the 2 stone tablets — the tablets of the covenant.

verses.kjv: And the LORD said unto me, Arise, get thee down quickly from hence; for thy people which thou hast brought forth out of Egypt have corrupted themselves; they are quickly turned aside out of the way which I commanded them; they have made them a molten image.
verses.ct: Then the LORD told me, 'Get up and go down from here quickly, because your people that you brought out of Egypt have become corrupt. They have already turned away from the path I commanded them to follow. They have made themselves an idol out of molten metal.'

verses.kjv: Furthermore the LORD spake unto me, saying, I have seen this people, and, behold, it is a stiffnecked people:
verses.ct: The LORD also said to me, 'I have watched this people, and they are clearly a stubborn people.

verses.kjv: Let me alone, that I may destroy them, and blot out their name from under heaven: and I will make of thee a nation mightier and greater than they.
verses.ct: Step aside and let me destroy them and erase their name from under heaven. Then I will make you into a nation more powerful and larger than they are.'

verses.kjv: So I turned and came down from the mount, and the mount burned with fire: and the two tables of the covenant were in my two hands.
verses.ct: So I turned and came down from the mountain while it was blazing with fire, carrying the 2 tablets of the covenant in my hands.

verses.kjv: And I looked, and, behold, ye had sinned against the LORD your God, and had made you a molten calf: ye had turned aside quickly out of the way which the LORD had commanded you.
verses.ct: When I looked, I could see that you had sinned against the LORD your God — you had made yourselves a molten calf. You had already turned away from the path the LORD had commanded you to follow.

verses.kjv: And I took the two tables, and cast them out of my two hands, and brake them before your eyes.
verses.ct: So I grabbed the 2 tablets and threw them from my hands, shattering them right in front of you.

verses.kjv: And I fell down before the LORD, as at the first, forty days and forty nights: I did neither eat bread, nor drink water, because of all your sins which ye sinned, in doing wickedly in the sight of the LORD, to provoke him to anger.
verses.ct: Then I threw myself down before the LORD for another 40 days and 40 nights, just like the first time. I ate no food and drank no water, because of all the sin you had committed — doing what was evil in the LORD's sight and provoking him to anger.

verses.kjv: For I was afraid of the anger and hot displeasure, wherewith the LORD was wroth against you to destroy you. But the LORD hearkened unto me at that time also.
verses.ct: I was terrified by the fierce anger the LORD had against you, angry enough to destroy you. But the LORD listened to me that time as well.

verses.kjv: And the LORD was very angry with Aaron to have destroyed him: and I prayed for Aaron also the same time.
verses.ct: The LORD was also furious enough with Aaron to destroy him, so I prayed for Aaron at that same time too.

verses.kjv: And I took your sin, the calf which ye had made, and burnt it with fire, and stamped it, and ground it very small, even until it was as small as dust: and I cast the dust thereof into the brook that descended out of the mount.
verses.ct: Then I took that sinful thing you had made — the calf — and burned it in the fire. I crushed it and ground it down until it was fine as dust, and I threw the dust into the stream that flowed down from the mountain.

verses.kjv: And at Taberah, and at Massah, and at Kibrothhattaavah, ye provoked the LORD to wrath.
verses.ct: You also provoked the LORD at Taberah, at Massah, and at Kibrothhattaavah.

verses.kjv: Likewise when the LORD sent you from Kadeshbarnea, saying, Go up and possess the land which I have given you; then ye rebelled against the commandment of the LORD your God, and ye believed him not, nor hearkened to his voice.
verses.ct: And when the LORD sent you from Kadeshbarnea, saying, 'Go up and take possession of the land I have given you,' you rebelled against the command of the LORD your God. You didn't trust him and you didn't listen to him.

verses.kjv: Ye have been rebellious against the LORD from the day that I knew you.
verses.ct: You have been rebellious against the LORD from the very first day I knew you.

verses.kjv: Thus I fell down before the LORD forty days and forty nights, as I fell down at the first; because the LORD had said he would destroy you.
verses.ct: So I threw myself down before the LORD for those 40 days and 40 nights, because the LORD had said he would destroy you.

verses.kjv: I prayed therefore unto the LORD, and said, O Lord GOD, destroy not thy people and thine inheritance, which thou hast redeemed through thy greatness, which thou hast brought forth out of Egypt with a mighty hand.
verses.ct: I prayed to the LORD and said, 'Lord GOD, please don't destroy your people, your own inheritance, whom you rescued through your greatness and brought out of Egypt with your mighty hand.

verses.kjv: Remember thy servants, Abraham, Isaac, and Jacob; look not unto the stubbornness of this people, nor to their wickedness, nor to their sin:
verses.ct: Remember your servants Abraham, Isaac, and Jacob. Don't focus on the stubbornness of this people, or on their wickedness, or on their sin.

verses.kjv: Lest the land whence thou broughtest us out say, Because the LORD was not able to bring them into the land which he promised them, and because he hated them, he hath brought them out to slay them in the wilderness.
verses.ct: Otherwise, the people in the land you brought us from will say, "The LORD wasn't able to bring them into the land he promised them, and because he hated them, he brought them out to kill them in the wilderness."

verses.kjv: Yet they are thy people and thine inheritance, which thou broughtest out by thy mighty power and by thy stretched out arm.
verses.ct: But they are your people, your own inheritance, whom you brought out by your great power and your outstretched arm.'
